intro: Dimeria ciliata var. heteromorpha, commonly known as the hairy dimeria, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, characterized by its distinctive nodes and often hollow stems. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense, terminal inflorescences. Its leaves are typically hairy and have a serrated margin, contributing to its adaptability in dry environments. The species is well-suited for xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and drought tolerance.
